Press a stop to check all buses at the stop, long-press for more options.

Search

You can search for stop numbers (on the blue signs) or names.
\"123\"
Stop names containing \"123\", or stop numbers starting with \"123\"
\"dun rich\"
Stop names containing all words, e.g. \"Dundas at Richmond St EB\"

Menus

Recent+Search
Stops you\'ve checked most often, otherwise alphabetical, that match the search
Recent (alphabetical)
Only the stops you\'ve checked before, sorted alphabetically, and only if the search is blank
Nearby+Search
Stops closest to you (needs GPS enabled) that match the search
Any
Stops serviced by any route
Route Number
Only stops serviced by that route

Be patient with GPS - it may take a few seconds to find your position. Only GPS is supported - Google\'s location service is not accurate enough, especially in areas with lots of stops like downtown.

Update Bus Data

LTC routes vary between weekdays, Saturdays and Sundays (that is, some buses call at different stops or in different directions). Therefore the app works best if it can update the database on each type of day. If you only ever take the bus on a weekday, you can safely ignore Saturdays and Sundays.

Updating routes usually takes less than 30 seconds. If the app needs to find the locations of new stops then it may take longer.

  • If all of the downloads are older than the age limit, an update is required, and you must update the database before you can check bus times.
  • If today\'s update is older than the age limit, but another update is younger, an update is recommended. You should probably update the database, but you may press the back key and check bus times. The app will keep annoying you about it, though.
  • If today\'s update is younger than the age limit, an update is not required.
